Reason: The key_cache_save_period configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the caching mechanism of keys, which can significantly affect the read performance of the system. A shorter save period may lead to more frequent cache updates, increasing memory consumption and potentially causing performance degradation. On the other hand, a longer save period may result in stale cache data, impacting read latency. Therefore, any change in the value of key_cache_save_period can have a notable impact on system performance.
